It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. Its flowers are usually pink or red, arranged in inflorescences that add visual interest to the landscape. Iphiona teretifolia is often grown in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
